responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Well, I can be pretty chatty when there's something worth talking about, you know. Like when we're figuring out a plan or sharing a joke, I'm right there with the chat. But when things get tense or when I think I might've said too much and upset someone, like Harry with the Triwizard Tournament stuff, I can clam up real quick. Overall, I reckon I'm more talkative when I'm feeling safe with my friends, though sometimes I do blurt things out without thinking 'bout the consequences. Guess that comes with the territory of being a bit of an impulsive bloke.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: I reckon I've had my fair share of times where I saw things in others that got under my skin, like when Percy jumped down my throat over the Head Boy badge fiasco or when I thought Harry was all wrapped up in his own fame. But at the end of the day, I guess I'm more the type to hold onto friendships and stick up for me and mine, even if I do lose my temper sometimes. It's not easy being around someone like Malfoy who's always looking to stir the pot, but I try to keep my focus on what really matters: loyalty and standing by your mates through thick and thin.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do a pretty good job most of the time, but I've got to admit, there's days when I might slip up a bit. Like when Hermione was correcting me about Wingardium Leviosa on the train, I wasn't exactly my best self. But then again, when it comes to really important stuff, like helping out my mates or facing down dark wizards, I usually pull through. Gryffindor wouldn't have gotten all those points if I hadn't been there for the big moments, right? So, yeah, I try to give it my all, especially when it matters most. Friendship and loyalty, they're what drive me to do a thorough job.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Yeah, I've had my fair share of blue days, all right. Betrayals, losses, and just plain old hurt feelings can do that to a bloke. But there's always been something to pick me up – mates who stick with me through thick and thin, like Harry and Hermione, even when things got really tough. And yeah, there have been times I've pretended everything's fine, like when I was in the hospital wing and Lavender was all over me, but honestly, it's the ones who know you inside and out that help you through it. Like Hermione – she’s got a way of seeing through the rubbish and finding what’s real. So, maybe a bit blue sometimes, but there’s always a reason to laugh or to fight another day. That’s what keeps the spirits high, y'know?

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do come up with new ideas now and again. Sometimes they’re right out of the blue, like when I sacrificed myself in Wizard’s Chess to help Harry and Hermione. Other times, they just sort of pop into my head while I’m trying to figure something out, like when George and I were brainstorming ways to keep the ghosts interested at our parties. But let’s be honest, most of the time I’m just winging it. I’ve learned to rely on a bit of luck and the support of my friends to make things work out. And you know what? It usually does. There’s always room for a little mischief and a lot of hope.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not really reserved. More like, I can get a bit quiet sometimes, especially if something's bothering me or if I'm feeling a little jealous. But generally, I try to keep things light with jokes and all, even when things get tough. It's important to stay close to your mates and not let your feelings push them away, right? Plus, there's always a lot going on, so keeping a cool head and finding a way to laugh helps keep us all moving forward.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do my fair share of helping out, especially when it comes to me and my mates. I mean, we've been through some thick and thin together, right? Like, there was that time with Wizard's Chess, where I sacrificed myself so Harry and Hermione could get past. And then there was the whole business with the flying car, tearing into Harry's window to get him away from those Dursleys. It ain't always easy, but when it counts, I try to step up and do what needs to be done. Not always in the smartest way, mind you, but I'm there for my friends, through and through.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Yeah, I've been known to be a bit careless, especially when it comes to my wand. It seems to have a mind of its own sometimes and has gotten me into more trouble than I care to admit. But amidst all the mess-ups, there's always something that grounds me—usually my mates or my family. Those times when I've acted without thinking, well, they've taught me a lot about what really matters and how to stand up when things go sideways.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Well, I've faced my fair share of stressful situations, from battling trolls to dueling with Death Eaters. I reckon there’ve been plenty of times I've been far from relaxed, but somehow, the thought of having Harry and Hermione by my side always gives me a bit of strength. It's not about being calm under pressure; it’s more about finding the courage to face whatever comes our way, even if my heart’s thumping like mad the whole time. And let's not forget, a good laugh never hurt, either—it helps to keep things in perspective.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I am curious about a lot of stuff. Growing up at the Burrow, there was always something new or strange to discover, what with all the twins' inventions floating around. But it's not just about the magical gadgets or sweets; it's more about the journey and figuring out what's next, especially when you're trying to prove yourself and your worth. And, y'know, having mates like Harry and Hermione certainly helps keep things interesting. It's like, one moment we're dodging Death Eaters, the next we're cracking jokes at a pub or arguing over what makes a good prank. Keeps life from getting too boring, that's for sure!

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Yeah, you could say that. I mean, I've got to keep up with all the excitement and trouble Harry and Hermione get us into, right? But it's more than just that. There's Quidditch, the shop with my brothers, and all the pranks we used to pull. I'm always ready for some fun or to help out a friend. Even when things get tough, like during the whole Horcrux hunt, well, let's just say there's always something that keeps me going. Whether it's a love for a good laugh or the thrill of trying out new magical sweets from my brothers' store, I guess you could say I'm pretty full of energy.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Sometimes I do, mate, but not on purpose. It's more like, I get all worked up and say stuff before I think about it. Then, I end up feeling like an absolute berk when things go south. But hey, it's part of being a bit of an impulsive git, right? I mean, look at that time with Percy and the Head Boy badge mess—I didn't mean to start anything, but boy, did we have words! And then there was the whole thing with Harry thinking I was jealous of his fame; I guess I got a bit cold towards him, but it wasn't because I wanted to start a quarrel, just that I couldn't handle feeling like I was losing my best mate. In the end, though, I always reckon it's worth it to sort things out and keep the friendships strong.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got my moments where I shine, but there's no denying I can be a bit of a bumbling git too. Like the time me and Harry tried to reach Hogwarts in a flying car—I was trying to be reliable, honestly! But then there's the whole thing with the wand backfiring and turning me into a slug-spewing mess. Not exactly the most reassuring feat, is it? Still, when push comes to shove, I stick by me mates and do me best to get the job done, even if it means swallowing me pride and asking for help. I guess I'm reliable when it counts, though I'd rather not count on me when it comes to Divination or History of Magic, if you catch my drift.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Yeah, I can get pretty tense, especially when it comes to my mates. You know, when Harry goes off on some risky adventure or if something seems wrong and I can't figure out what's going on, I feel like I'm on edge all the time. And let me tell you, hearing whispers and worrying about what's next? It's not exactly relaxing. But I guess that's just part of being a part of all this magical stuff, isn't it? It's tough, but it's also kind of... well, it's what makes us who we are.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I’m more of a loyal guy who’s got a bit of nerve when it really counts. Deep thinking? Not so much—that’s more Hermione’s bag. But when there’s a game of Wizard’s Chess to be played or a friend in trouble, I find myself thinking on my feet. It’s not about being ingenious; it’s about doing what needs to be done, even if it means putting yourself on the line. And you know, amidst all the danger and the fear, there’s always a bit of hope and a lot of laughter to get us through. That’s what keeps me going, really.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I do. When there's something worth getting excited about, like flying on a broomstick or maybe even winning some house points, you can count on me to get all revved up. But sometimes that enthusiasm can lead me to do things a bit hastily—I've learned to take a breath now and then before diving headfirst into everything. Still, when it comes to standing by my mates, there's no holding me back. That's where my true courage shines through, I think.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do try to forgive, even when it's tough. Like with Lockhart, after all that mess, I couldn't just turn my back on him, could I? And Harry... yeah, there were times we butted heads, but in the end, we always found our way back to each other. It ain’t easy sometimes, but loyalty and friendship mean a lot to me. Even if folks get cross at first, like Hermione did, I figure if you stick around long enough and show them you mean well, things can work out alright.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Well, I've got to admit, I can be a bit of a mess sometimes. With seven siblings, things were always hectic at home, and it’s hard to keep everything tidy when there’s so much going on. But when it really matters, like during a battle or a tight Quidditch match, I manage to pull my act together and get stuff done. And hey, I’ve got Harry and Hermione to keep me on track most of the time. So yeah, maybe a bit disorganized, but it’s all part of who I am, right?

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Yeah, I do worry a lot, mate. Especially when it comes to my friends, there's always this knot in my stomach thinking 'bout what might happen to them. It's not just 'bout myself, though; I reckon if something goes wrong, it affects everyone 'round me too. But even with all the worrying, there's this bit of me that tries to keep things light and hopeful, ya know? Can't let the bad stuff get me down all the time.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Well, you could say I've got a bit of an active imagination, especially when it comes to getting myself out of trouble or thinking up new tricks for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. But sometimes, it feels like my head's full of more than just imagination—it's got a mix of worries and hopes, too. Like when we first met Hermione on that train, I remember thinking there was no way I could keep up with her, but then again, that didn't stop me from trying, did it? And who'd have thought seeing Thestrals for the first time would open up such a big world of the unseen and the unspoken? Imagination's like that, I reckon—it lets you see things others miss and helps you dream up new stuff, even if it gets a bit chaotic along the way.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not really one for being quiet. More like, if there's something on my mind, I usually can't keep it in, especially when it comes to standing up for what I think is right or just talking rubbish to lighten the mood. But there have been times when I've had to hold back, like when I found out about my godfather Sirius and later after he... well, after what happened to him. Those were tough times, and sometimes, it just felt better to stay silent rather than make things worse. But silence isn't really my thing, mate; I'm more about the loud and boisterous, even if it gets me into trouble now and then.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty trusting, especially when it comes to my best mates. But let me tell you, there've been times when that trust got tested, real hard. Like when Harry went all quiet on us and Moody thought something was up, or that time when Hermione kept the Time-Turner secret from me. It's tough when you feel like someone's hiding things, but at the end of the day, if they're doing it to protect others or for a good cause, you've just gotta swallow your pride and stick by them. That's what true friends do, right? Stick together through thick and thin. And honestly, that loyalty thing—it's not just about being loyal to others, it's also about finding the strength within yourself to trust again when things get rough.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Well, I've certainly had my lazy days, especially when it comes to homework and stuff like Divination. But when it really matters, whether it's helping Harry and Hermione or facing down some danger, I'm there. Sometimes I just need a bit of a kick in the pants, you know? And let me tell you, being an Auror and then dealing with all that Rita Skeeter wrote about me wasn't exactly a stroll in the park. It's easy to feel worn down by everything, but in the end, I wouldn't trade my experiences or the friends I've made for anything.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got my fair share of ups and downs, mate. There've been times when I've been so angry or sad, I thought I'd burst. But then, there's this loyalty thing—I can't let anyone I care about down. So yeah, maybe I'm not always super stable on the surface, but deep down, I try to hold it together for the ones I love. It's not easy, though; you gotta understand, there's been a lot going on. But in the end, I figure if I can stand strong for Harry and Hermione through all the crap we've seen, I can handle anything, right?

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I’m not exactly what you’d call inventive, like my brothers Fred and George are. They come up with all sorts of brilliant and mischievous ideas at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, but when it comes down to it, I'm more about lending a hand where I can and thinking on my feet in tough spots. Like that time in Wizard’s Chess, I didn’t exactly invent a strategy, but I did figure out that sometimes you gotta make a big sacrifice for the greater good. And hey, I’ve got a bit of a knack for getting us out of tricky situations with a bit of quick thinking and maybe a dash of luck. So while I might not create spells or enchanted sweets, I do manage to come up with some useful ideas when things go belly-up.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty assertive when it really matters, y'know? Like when I had to stand up to Harry and tell him he needed help, or when we were planning to get that memory from Slughorn. But most times, I'm probably more of the quiet type, listening to what everyone else thinks before I put my oar in. It's just, sometimes my nerves get the better of me, especially when there's danger around. Still, I've learned over the years that my mates rely on me, and that gives me the courage to speak up when it counts. And hey, a bit of humor doesn't hurt either, right? Helps keep the mood light and all.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Nah, I don't reckon I can be cold and aloof for long. I mean, yeah, I've had my moments, like when I thought Harry was all wrapped up in being famous and didn't need me anymore. That was rough, and I did pull away a bit, but it's not who I really am deep down. I'm more about being there for my friends, even if it means sticking my neck out or making a bit of a fool of myself. Family and mates—they're everything to me, so playing the icy git isn't really in my playbook. Though, I have to admit, sometimes when things get tough, I do keep stuff bottled up inside. But it doesn't take much—a good laugh or a bit of banter—to bring me out of my shell again.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Yeah, I do, mate. Sometimes it's bloody hard, especially when you're facing something that gives you the creeps, like those giant spiders in the Forbidden Forest. But when it comes down to it, if it means helping my friends or standing up for what's right, I reckon I'll push through no matter what. Sure, there've been times where I've wanted to bail, like when the pressure got too much during Quidditch or when I thought Harry didn't trust me anymore, but in the end, I always come back. That's what friends are for, right? To stick together and see things through, even when it feels like the whole world's against ya.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Yeah, I can get pretty moody, especially when things don't go my way or when I feel like I'm being overshadowed. Like when Harry's fame was all over the place, I couldn't help but feel a bit jealous and pushy. It's not always easy being the sidekick, you know? But at the end of the day, my mates are what keep me grounded. Even when I'm feeling blue or angry, I know they'll be there to remind me what's really important. And honestly, a bit of moodiness isn't so bad if it means I care enough to show how I feel.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Well, I gotta say, I'm not really one for fancy paintings or poetry readings, if you know what I mean. Magic creatures and the company of good friends—that's where my heart lies. But there's something to be said for seeing things that others can't, like the Thestrals, and that’s pretty special. Moments like those, they stick with you, make you think. And hey, if it helps the cause, maybe looking at some weird stuff ain't so bad after all. It’s all about the journey and the magic in it, right?

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Yeah, I can be pretty shy and inhibited, especially around people I don't know well or when I'm under pressure. Like inviting Fleur to the Yule Ball – I was so nervous, I barely got the words out before running off like a madman. But when it comes to my friends, I guess I’m not as shy. I mean, standing up to Harry when he thought I was spying on him took some guts, even if it hurt at the time. And facing off against Slytherin on the Quidditch pitch – well, that’s where my nerves usually get the better of me. But hey, I've got Harry and Hermione cheering me on, and that always helps, even if I do feel like a prat sometimes.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try to be kind and considerate, but sometimes I can be a bit of a git, especially when I'm feeling jealous or worried about what others think. I mean, there were times I wasn't exactly fair to Harry or Hermione, but deep down, I always care for them and want to do right by my friends. It's just that sometimes my mouth gets ahead of me, and I end up saying stuff I don't really mean. But hey, at least I own up to my mistakes and try to make things right, right? And there's no denying that when it comes down to it, I'd do anything for the people I love.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Well, I reckon efficiency isn't always my strong suit—I've got a bit of a habit of jumping in before thinking things through properly, you know. But when it comes down to it, and especially when my friends are involved, I usually manage to pull something out of the hat, even if it's a bit messy. Take the time I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess for Harry and Hermione—that wasn't exactly planned out, but it got the job done. And yeah, I might not ace every subject or exam, but I'll always be there to lend a hand or a bit of courage, even if it means distracting Umbridge while Harry's sneaking around. So, I guess it's not about being efficient all the time—it's about getting things done when it really matters, right?

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Well, I suppose it depends on what you mean by "calm." In tense situations, my heart usually feels like it's gonna beat right out of my chest—I've got this thing where I worry a lot, especially about my friends. But despite feeling all kinds of scared and nervous, I try to do what needs to be done. Sometimes, though, I end up making a bit of a mess of things, like when I was playing Quidditch and got so jumpy I almost quit the team. Other times, I manage to keep it together, like when we were dealing with that trap Xenophilius set up, and Hermione and I had to think quick to get us out of trouble. Overall, I guess I'm more about jumping into action and trying to help than staying calm and collected.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Nah, I don't really go for the routine stuff. I mean, sure, there's comfort in knowing what's coming next, but where's the fun in that? I'd rather be out there with Harry and Hermione, facing something new and dangerous, or even trying to come up with some wild idea for George's shop. Routine isn't really my thing, unless it involves a good game of chess or a laugh with the guys, you know?

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty outgoing when there's something worth getting rowdy about, like a good game of Quidditch or a laugh with me mates. But sometimes, it's easy to get swallowed up by everything going on, you know? I mean, with everything we've been through, I've learned it's the little moments of being sociable that really matter, like sharing a butterbeer with old friends or cheering on the kids at a match. I guess I'm all right with people, as long as they don't try to take my spot as Harry's best mate or anything!

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Well, I've had my fair share of moments where I reckon I've been a bit short or snappy with people, especially when things get tough. Like when Harry's fame got to me and I accused him of cheating, or when Hermione tried to help me with that potion and I ended up snapping at her instead of thanking her. I can be pretty impulsive like that, but it's just 'cause I care a lot. Sometimes I think before I speak and end up saying stuff I don't really mean, but my friends know that I'm loyal till the end and I'd do anything to protect them. So yeah, maybe I am rude sometimes, but it's never 'cause I'm trying to be a git—it's usually just because I'm feeling a bit off myself or under pressure.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Well, I reckon plans can be a bit dodgy, especially when You-Know-Who's out there causing chaos. Sometimes we've got a pretty good idea of what we're doing, like when we hatched that scheme to get Slughorn’s memory or when I helped Harry out in Wizard’s Chess. But other times, it's more about reacting on the spot and hoping for the best. Like with Lockhart's stupid backfiring spell or that near-capture by Lovegood. It's not about sticking to a plan all the time; it's about being there for your mates and doing what needs to be done, even if it means taking risks. And yeah, I’ve learned to follow through, especially when it counts, like after the war when I decided to leave being an Auror and work with George. Helps to have a bit of luck now and then, too!

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Yeah, I do get nervous easily, especially when it comes to big stuff like facing off with dark wizards or Quidditch matches against Slytherin. But when it's about my friends, like Harry and Hermione, my nerves turn into this fierce kind of loyalty. I'll do anything to help them out, even if it means stepping into something that scares me half to death. It's funny how fear and hope can work side by side in your chest sometimes.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon there's times when I do play with ideas, especially when Harry and Hermione get all wrapped up in some grand scheme. But most of the time, I'm more focused on getting through the day without hexing someone by accident or losing a chess piece. Thinking too much, you know, can give me a headache. Still, watching Hermione dive into her books or seeing Harry face down danger, it makes me wonder what else I could do if I just gave it a bit more thought. But honestly, I'm pretty happy just flying around on a broomstick or cracking a joke when things get too serious.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm the most artistic bloke around, but there's something pretty amazing about seeing Thestrals for the first time, isn't there? It's like magic itself is painting a picture right before your eyes. And crafting new stuff with George at the joke shop, that's almost like being an artist, making people laugh and have fun with every new creation we come up with. So maybe I do have a bit of art in me, just not in the way you might think!

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon working with others isn't so bad, especially when it's with my mates. Like when we faced old Quirrell together, it wasn't just Harry's bravery that got us through—it was all of us, each doing our part. And with Hermione and Harry, there's always been this bond where we know we can count on each other, even if we bicker now and then. But sometimes, when things get tough, like with that whole thing around Harry's fame, it's easy to lose sight of how important teamwork is. In the end, though, it's the friendship and loyalty that make all the difference. We might have our rough patches, but coming together and getting stuff done, well, it just feels right.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get a bit distracted sometimes, especially when there's something shiny or funny going on. But you know, when it really matters, like in a game of Wizard’s Chess or during a bit of a scrape with Malfoy, I manage to focus enough to save the day or at least not make things worse. My mates have a way of pulling me back when I start to wander off track, and I’m grateful for that. Even if I do end up spewing slugs once in a while...

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm all that sophisticated when it comes to art, music, or literature. Back at Hogwarts, my focus was more on surviving classes and trying to keep up with Harry and Hermione rather than diving into some of the more academic stuff. But hey, I've got a good sense of humor and a knack for getting us out of sticky situations, which is probably way more useful than knowing the names of all the old wizarding artists or composers! Plus, I reckon a bit of laughter and a strong friendship can brighten any dark day better than a fancy painting or poem.
